DOC.HEAD: Six Killed in Rooming House Blaze
DOC.TEXT: Workers pulled two more bodies Tuesday out of the charred remains of a downtown rooming house that was set on fire over the weekend, bringing the death toll to six. The blaze occurred Saturday after a pile of garbage was set on fire in a hallway, causing about $600,000 damage to the building. Police have charged a Toronto man with three counts of second-degree murder. Gordon Freeman, 49, is to appear in provincial court Wednesday. Police constable Bill Thomson said police will file further charges after they are certain there are no more bodies. The 60 residents left homeless by the fire were given turkey dinners at a Salvation Army shelter Christmas Day. Spokesman Harold Zimmerman said the Salvation Army will help them find permanent homes later this week.
